experiment_report_title: Pricing Page Redesign - Q4 2024 Experiment Results
experiment_name: Pricing Page Redesign - Annual Discount Emphasis

hypothesis.statement: Simplified pricing tiers with prominent annual discount messaging will increase conversion rates by 15%
hypothesis.rationale: User research indicates customers are confused by complex pricing tiers and miss the value proposition of annual plans

variants.name: control
variants.description: Current pricing page with 4 tiers (Free, Basic, Pro, Enterprise)

variants.name: treatment_v2
variants.description: 3 tiers with annual discount highlighted in green banner

criteria: Country: US, CA, GB, AU (English-speaking markets)

sample_size.note: Traffic rebalanced mid-experiment after early signals showed treatment_v1 underperformance

primary_metric.metric_description: Percentage of users who converted to a paid plan within 7 days

time_on_page.description: Average time spent on pricing page (seconds)
time_on_page.insight: Treatment_v2 users spent 21% more time engaging with pricing information

scroll_depth.description: Percentage of users who scrolled to bottom of page
scroll_depth.insight: Treatment_v2 design encouraged more complete page exploration

pricing_table_clicks.description: Number of clicks on pricing tier cards
pricing_table_clicks.insight: Treatment_v2 annual discount banner drove more engagement

annual_plan_selection_rate.description: Percentage of converters who chose annual billing
annual_plan_selection_rate.insight: Treatment_v2 dramatically increased annual plan adoption

revenue_impact.description: Estimated revenue impact based on average order value and plan selection

annualized_revenue_projection.note: Based on 20.3% conversion lift and 9% revenue per user lift

statistical_analysis.methodology: Bayesian A/B testing with frequentist validation

frequentist_analysis.result: Reject null hypothesis - treatment_v2 significantly better than control

sequential_testing.note: Experiment could have been stopped early at day 14 with same conclusion

mobile.insight: Mobile users benefited more from simplified design

social.insight: Social traffic showed highest lift, likely due to clear value prop

enterprise_50_plus.insight: Smaller teams benefited more from simplified pricing

novelty_effect_analysis.description: Analysis of conversion rates over time to detect novelty effects
novelty_effect_analysis.conclusion: Some novelty effect detected (lift decreased from 25.6% to 14.4%), but treatment still significantly better than control
novelty_effect_analysis.recommendation: Monitor post-launch metrics for 4 weeks to confirm sustained lift

recommendations.primary_recommendation: Deploy treatment_v2 (annual discount emphasis) to 100% of traffic

implementation_plan.phase_1: Deploy to 25% of traffic for 1 week
implementation_plan.monitoring: Track conversion rates, revenue metrics, and customer feedback for 4 weeks post-launch

follow_up_experiments: Test different annual discount percentages (20% vs 30% vs 40%)
Test placement of annual discount banner (top vs inline vs sticky)
A/B test enterprise tier messaging for larger companies
key_learnings: Users respond strongly to clear value propositions (annual savings)
Visual emphasis (green banner) effectively draws attention
Mobile users benefit more from simplified layouts
Smaller teams show higher lift than enterprise customers
